p: We now turn to the phase transition itself. It is familiar behaviour that, starting from the orthorhombic phase of MnGF or CoGF, the same rhombohedral phase can be achieved either by applying pressure or by increasing the cation size. For instance, many NaCl-type alkali halides and pseudohalides transform to the CsCl structure under pressure [ 30]. Considering the inorganic perovskites, in a similar way the ‘post-perovskite’ phase of MgSiO 3 adopts the CaIrO 3 structure [ 31]. These phase transitions each involve a change in coordination number about the metal ions, and hence a change in the bonding topology.
